subject: Parenting
title: Neuroplasticity in Children
description: A fast breakdown of Neuroplasticity in Children for builders.

hook.text: A child loses the left hemisphere to surgery. A year later, she speaks normally.

buildup.text: Young brains are staggeringly plastic â€” they rewire around damage that would cripple an adult.

discovery.text: Neuroplasticity means the brain reassigns functions to undamaged areas.

twist.text: This superpower fades with age. By adolescence, the brain is far less flexible.

climax.text: Early intervention works precisely because young brains still rewire easily.

punchline.text: Young brains bend. Older brains break.

quiz.question: Why is early intervention especially effective for developmental issues?
options: Young brains can rewire more easily
Medications work better on small bodies
